title: What's News --  World-Wide
text:
U.S. health regulators significantly widened the nation's Covid-19 booster campaign, clearing use of extra doses of Moderna and J&J vaccines and saying people can get a shot that is different from what they had previously received.

---

Democrats in the Senate are considering abandoning central tax elements of their social policy and climate package as Sen. Sinema continues to oppose any increase in marginal rates for businesses, high-income individuals or capital gains.

---

Senate Democrats' latest effort to overhaul election rules nationwide was blocked by Republicans, leaving the effort at a standstill and progressive activists frustrated.

---

Trump unveiled a new digital media venture and said it would go public by merging with a special-purpose acquisition company.

---

Nikolas Cruz pleaded guilty to killing 17 students and staff members and attempting to kill 17 others in the 2018 school shooting in Parkland, Fla.

---

A Brazilian Senate investigation into Bolsonaro recommended that he face criminal charges over his handling of the coronavirus pandemic.
